messageBody:
Hi All,

I was using the the ExpectedException rule, and realized that after getting the expected exception it "sinks" every following exception, whats more I couldn't even reset it't expectations.
Am I missing something, or is this the proper behavior?

See the following code which runs successfully:
public class Expect {

@Rule
public ExpectedException exception = ExpectedException.none();

@Test
public void test() throws Exception
{
exception.expect(NullPointerException.class);
throwNullPointer();
throwNullPointer();
throwException();
exception = ExpectedException.none();
throwNullPointer();
throwException();
exception = null;
throwNullPointer();
throwException();
}

private void throwNullPointer()
{
throw new NullPointerException();
}

private void throwException() throws Exception
{
throw new Exception();
}
}

Thanks in advance,
Tam√°s
